intro: Cnicus eriophorus, commonly known as the prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions. It grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Cnicus eriophorus is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
